lines: You are waiting for some important news that might drastically effect the course of your life. For some strange reason, every time you think about what is happening you get the urge to munch on something.
On what would you like to nibble?

You think, worry a bit and munch, think, worry a bit and munch, think, worry a bit and munch. Your Thoughtfulness score shows that you are a bit on the impulsive side. As a result, you don't really pay that much attention to what you are
wind up giving yourself a bad case of indigestion.

You think, worry a bit and munch, but have the self control necessary to keep from developing the kind of "eating when nervous" habit that would make this vignette a big event in more than one sense of the word. Your munching actually
They are healthy, but unsatisfying. You eat so many of them that you imagine your front teeth growing and get an unusual spring in your step.

Since you are generally a calm person, this is a healthy undertaking. Your productivity during these periods offsets the anxiety you feel about the news you are waiting to hear. Be careful not to become a workaholic.

You are a pretty calm person, so this seems like a good idea. By and large you have trouble finishing the work you begin, and as a result feel like you are under even more stress. Perhaps you should relax a bit more.
You are not a very calm person, so this idea may actually make things worse. You search for things to keep you busy, but they backfire, leaving you feeling both worried and incompetent.
This can lead to disastrous outcomes.
Fortunately, you have the self-control necessary to keep your eating habits in check. You could gain a lot of weight eating when you are nervous.
You gain 10 pounds waiting for the news to arrive.
You gain 20 pounds waiting for the news to arrive.
